headline: Evolution in action
text: Central Africa's roiling, rapid Lower Congo River is home to an extraordinary assortment of fish -- many truly bizarre (see above). In this video, we follow Melanie Stiassny, Curator of Ichthyology at the American Museum of Natural History, as she and her team search the Lower Congo River's mysterious depths for an evolutionary driver that may help us understand why so many species have evolved in this particular region.
